div.p: [...] that one should always trust in God; whatever he can do to serve peace and tranquility, that he should do. The proclamation of the day is certain. Our envoys have been chosen: Junker Hans Lux Escher, treasurer, and the Silherr Master Johannes Kammli; since my lord Cham has not yet returned home, for whom they waited for a while. Bern, from afar, has not yet responded; but we are undoubtedly confident, now the envoys are on the road. Glarus, Basel, Schaffhausen have responded to my lords, they will send their envoys, etc. Therefore, even if some delay were to occur, the journey would not be postponed - as it cannot be delayed any longer -, and understand that everyone is willing to part and to ensure that we remain with the religion and freedoms... - Today early after 4, Balthasar the interpreter was with me, informed me how he was at your house, you were walking in a meadow, etc. Understood that he rides to Solothurn, perhaps the lord would also come to the meeting, as I had previously requested from him in writing [...]
19th of May, 1 o'clock in the afternoon, 1566.
